alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Rooks (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 22 at 1:51PM CDT until April 23 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions This Afternoon and Evening... ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Possible Again Saturday Afternoon... ...A Red Flag Warning is in effect until 9 PM CDT this evening for wind and low relative humidity for portions of north central Kansas and south central Nebraska generally along and west of Highway 281... The National Weather Service in Hastings has also issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity across portions of north central Kansas and south central Nebraska generally along and west of Highway 281, which is in effect from Saturday afternoon through Saturday evening. * WINDS...South 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph today. Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph Saturday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 20 to 25 percent today. As low as 15 to 20 percent Saturday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite may spread rapidly and exhibit extreme fire behavior. Use extreme caution if engaging in activities that could result in fire ignition.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
